part_name: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

chunks.text:
### Definitions

For the purposes of this Appendix, a “family group” means two or more applicants who are related to one another as a parent, child or partner, who have confirmed on their Expression of Interest application that they are applying with other family members.

For the purposes of this Appendix, a “family reference number” means the reference provided to an applicant who applies first and indicates that they are applying as part of a family group. That applicant then provides the family reference number to all other members of the family group for them to provide as part of their Expression of Interest application.

For the purposes of this Appendix, “the cap’’ means the total number of individuals removed from the UK through the pilot arrangement on prevention of dangerous journeys at the end of the pilot period.

For the purposes of this Appendix, “application window” means a period determined by the Secretary of State for the Home Department in which Expression of Interest applications may be submitted under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme, having regard to the need to meet the cap.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants applying under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme, especially those forming family groups. Key requirements include identifying family relationships via a family reference number and submitting applications within designated windows to comply with the cap. Exceptions or thresholds hinge on the cap and the application window set by the Secretary of State.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
Section ID: Definitions
Section: Definitions
Topic: definitions

Summary: This provision applies to applicants applying under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme, especially those forming family groups. Key requirements include identifying family relationships via a family reference number and submitting applications within designated windows to comply with the cap. Exceptions or thresholds hinge on the cap and the application window set by the Secretary of State.

### Definitions

For the purposes of this Appendix, a “family group” means two or more applicants who are related to one another as a parent, child or partner, who have confirmed on their Expression of Interest application that they are applying with other family members.

For the purposes of this Appendix, a “family reference number” means the reference provided to an applicant who applies first and indicates that they are applying as part of a family group. That applicant then provides the family reference number to all other members of the family group for them to provide as part of their Expression of Interest application.

For the purposes of this Appendix, “the cap’’ means the total number of individuals removed from the UK through the pilot arrangement on prevention of dangerous journeys at the end of the pilot period.

For the purposes of this Appendix, “application window” means a period determined by the Secretary of State for the Home Department in which Expression of Interest applications may be submitted under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme, having regard to the need to meet the cap.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.section_title: Void applications due to previous rejections or changes

chunks.text:
### Void applications

1.   UEATS 1.1. A person’s Expression of Interest application will be void if a person has previously submitted an Expression of Interest application and any of the following apply: 
    1.   a) it was rejected because the person was outside France; or
    2.   b) the stated family unit applying has changed between applications (unless the change is as a result of a birth or death in the family); or
    3.   c) entry clearance was refused.

UEATS 1.2. A person cannot make multiple active applications at the same time. Where multiple applications are made, only one will be considered.

UEATS 1.3. A person’s entry clearance application will be void if they have not provided any required biometrics.

UEATS 1.4. If a person with an outstanding Expression of Interest or Entry Clearance application under this Scheme travels to the UK and arrives or enters without permission, their application will be void.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to UK/European applicants under the UK/EU Applicant Transfer Scheme. It states that applications are void if previously rejected, the family unit changes (excluding births or deaths), or biometrics are not provided; multiple concurrent applications are not allowed; and applications become void if the applicant enters the UK without permission.
chunks.augmented_text:

Section: Void applications due to previous rejections or changes
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to UK/European applicants under the UK/EU Applicant Transfer Scheme. It states that applications are void if previously rejected, the family unit changes (excluding births or deaths), or biometrics are not provided; multiple concurrent applications are not allowed; and applications become void if the applicant enters the UK without permission.

### Void applications

1.   UEATS 1.1. A person’s Expression of Interest application will be void if a person has previously submitted an Expression of Interest application and any of the following apply: 
    1.   a) it was rejected because the person was outside France; or
    2.   b) the stated family unit applying has changed between applications (unless the change is as a result of a birth or death in the family); or
    3.   c) entry clearance was refused.

UEATS 1.2. A person cannot make multiple active applications at the same time. Where multiple applications are made, only one will be considered.

UEATS 1.3. A person’s entry clearance application will be void if they have not provided any required biometrics.

UEATS 1.4. If a person with an outstanding Expression of Interest or Entry Clearance application under this Scheme travels to the UK and arrives or enters without permission, their application will be void.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements

UEATS 2.1. A person making an Expression of Interest application for the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme must apply online using the specified form: Register for the UK/European Applicant Transfer scheme.

UEATS 2.2. A person making an Expression of Interest application for the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme must be in France when they submit their application as confirmed by information requested by the Home Office to confirm their location.

1.   UEATS 2.3. An Expression of Interest for the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   a) the applicant must be aged 18 or over on the date the Expression of Interest application is submitted unless they are applying as part of a family group with a parent who is aged 18 or over; and
    2.   b) the applicant must not be an EEA national, or enjoy free movement rights as a family member of an EEA national; and
    3.   c) the applicant must upload a copy of a passport or other document and a recent photograph which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality as part of their Expression of Interest application; and
    4.   d) the applicant must have submitted their Expression of Interest application within an application window; and
    5.   e) the applicant must not have been granted international protection by another country which, for this purpose, includes being officially recognised as stateless; and
    6.   f) the applicant must not have immigration permission in France; and
    7.   g) the applicant must not have declared any information on their Expression of Interest application form that could lead to a refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   UEATS 2.4. An applicant who is applying first as part of a family group must: 
    1.   a) confirm on their Expression of Interest application form that they are applying as part of a family group; and
    2.   b) have listed the names of all other family members who are applying as part of their family group on their Expression of Interest application.

1.   UEATS 2.5. All family members in a family group applying after the first applicant must: 
    1.   a) indicate that they are applying as part of a family group on their Expression of Interest application; and
    2.   b) provide the family reference number for their family group on their Expression of Interest application as provided to them by the first applicant; and
    3.   c) provide satisfactory evidence of their family connection to the family group.

UEATS 2.6. An Expression of Interest application under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme which does not meet all of the validity requirements will be rejected as invalid and not considered.

UEATS 2.7. If an Expression of Interest application under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme submitted as part of a family group is rejected as invalid, all linked applications in that family group will also be rejected as invalid and not considered.

1.   UEATS 2.8. An application for entry clearance under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   a) The application for entry clearance must have been made by the Home Office on behalf of the applicant after a valid Expression of Interest application has been selected for consideration for entry clearance; and
    2.   b) The applicant must have provided any required biometrics; and
    3.   c) The applicant must have provided a passport or other document which satisfactorily established their identity and nationality.

UEATS 2.9. An Expression of Interest application submitted after the cap has been reached will be rejected.

UEATS 2.10. Expression of Interest applications will be rejected if they have not been selected for consideration for entry clearance at the point the cap is reached.
chunks.summary: The provision applies to individuals submitting an Expression of Interest under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme. Applicants must apply online from France, be aged 18 or over (or with a parent), not be EEA nationals or have free movement rights, and upload identity documents within specified application windows. Key conditions include current location in France and not having international protection elsewhere.

Summary: The provision applies to individuals submitting an Expression of Interest under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme. Applicants must apply online from France, be aged 18 or over (or with a parent), not be EEA nationals or have free movement rights, and upload identity documents within specified application windows. Key conditions include current location in France and not having international protection elsewhere.

### Validity requirements

UEATS 2.1. A person making an Expression of Interest application for the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme must apply online using the specified form: Register for the UK/European Applicant Transfer scheme.

UEATS 2.2. A person making an Expression of Interest application for the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme must be in France when they submit their application as confirmed by information requested by the Home Office to confirm their location.

1.   UEATS 2.3. An Expression of Interest for the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   a) the applicant must be aged 18 or over on the date the Expression of Interest application is submitted unless they are applying as part of a family group with a parent who is aged 18 or over; and
    2.   b) the applicant must not be an EEA national, or enjoy free movement rights as a family member of an EEA national; and
    3.   c) the applicant must upload a copy of a passport or other document and a recent photograph which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality as part of their Expression of Interest application; and
    4.   d) the applicant must have submitted their Expression of Interest application within an application window; and
    5.   e) the applicant must not have been granted international protection by another country which, for this purpose, includes being officially recognised as stateless; and
    6.   f) the applicant must not have immigration permission in France; and
    7.   g) the applicant must not have declared any information on their Expression of Interest application form that could lead to a refusal under Part Suitability.

1.   UEATS 2.4. An applicant who is applying first as part of a family group must: 
    1.   a) confirm on their Expression of Interest application form that they are applying as part of a family group; and
    2.   b) have listed the names of all other family members who are applying as part of their family group on their Expression of Interest application.

1.   UEATS 2.5. All family members in a family group applying after the first applicant must: 
    1.   a) indicate that they are applying as part of a family group on their Expression of Interest application; and
    2.   b) provide the family reference number for their family group on their Expression of Interest application as provided to them by the first applicant; and
    3.   c) provide satisfactory evidence of their family connection to the family group.

UEATS 2.6. An Expression of Interest application under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme which does not meet all of the validity requirements will be rejected as invalid and not considered.

UEATS 2.7. If an Expression of Interest application under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme submitted as part of a family group is rejected as invalid, all linked applications in that family group will also be rejected as invalid and not considered.

1.   UEATS 2.8. An application for entry clearance under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   a) The application for entry clearance must have been made by the Home Office on behalf of the applicant after a valid Expression of Interest application has been selected for consideration for entry clearance; and
    2.   b) The applicant must have provided any required biometrics; and
    3.   c) The applicant must have provided a passport or other document which satisfactorily established their identity and nationality.

UEATS 2.9. An Expression of Interest application submitted after the cap has been reached will be rejected.

UEATS 2.10. Expression of Interest applications will be rejected if they have not been selected for consideration for entry clearance at the point the cap is reached.

metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements

UEATS 3.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

UEATS 3.2. The applicant must not have previously entered or arrived illegally in the UK.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to UK/EU applicants under the UK/EU European Applicant Transfer Scheme. Applicants must not be unsuitable under Part Suitability and must not have previously entered or arrived illegally in the UK. No exceptions or additional thresholds are specified.

Summary: This provision applies to UK/EU applicants under the UK/EU European Applicant Transfer Scheme. Applicants must not be unsuitable under Part Suitability and must not have previously entered or arrived illegally in the UK. No exceptions or additional thresholds are specified.

### Suitability requirements

UEATS 3.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

UEATS 3.2. The applicant must not have previously entered or arrived illegally in the UK.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

chunks.text:
### Entry clearance application eligibility requirements

UEATS 4.1. The applicant must not have been granted international protection in another country since submitting their Expression of Interest application.

UEATS 4.2. The applicant must not have immigration status in France.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to UK/European applicants seeking entry clearance. They must not have received international protection elsewhere since submitting their Expression of Interest and must not hold immigration status in France. No exceptions are specified.
chunks.augmented_text:

Section: Entry clearance application eligibility requirements
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to UK/European applicants seeking entry clearance. They must not have received international protection elsewhere since submitting their Expression of Interest and must not hold immigration status in France. No exceptions are specified.

### Entry clearance application eligibility requirements

UEATS 4.1. The applicant must not have been granted international protection in another country since submitting their Expression of Interest application.

UEATS 4.2. The applicant must not have immigration status in France.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.section_id: Decision on an application for UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.section_title: Decision on an application for UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application for UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

UEATS 5.1. An entry clearance application which does not meet the suitability or eligibility requirements will be refused, otherwise it will be granted, subject to UEATS 5.2. and UEATS 5.3.

UEATS 5.2. If the entry clearance application was submitted as part of a family group and is refused, entry clearance will be refused in respect of all linked applications in that family group.

UEATS 5.3. If the cap has been reached before entry clearance is granted, the entry clearance application will be refused regardless of whether the Expression of Interest application is valid.
chunks.summary: The provision applies to applicants seeking UK/European Transfer Scheme entry clearance. Applications must meet suitability and eligibility criteria to be granted; otherwise, they will be refused. If part of a family group, all linked applications are refused on rejection, and applications are also refused if the cap is reached before approval.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
Section ID: Decision on an application for UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
Section: Decision on an application for UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
Topic: eligibility

Summary: The provision applies to applicants seeking UK/European Transfer Scheme entry clearance. Applications must meet suitability and eligibility criteria to be granted; otherwise, they will be refused. If part of a family group, all linked applications are refused on rejection, and applications are also refused if the cap is reached before approval.

### Decision on an application for UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

UEATS 5.1. An entry clearance application which does not meet the suitability or eligibility requirements will be refused, otherwise it will be granted, subject to UEATS 5.2. and UEATS 5.3.

UEATS 5.2. If the entry clearance application was submitted as part of a family group and is refused, entry clearance will be refused in respect of all linked applications in that family group.

UEATS 5.3. If the cap has been reached before entry clearance is granted, the entry clearance application will be refused regardless of whether the Expression of Interest application is valid.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.section_title: Cancellation of permission under UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

chunks.text:
### Cancellation of permission under UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

1.   UEATS 6.1. Permission under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme may be cancelled if: 
    1.   a) the applicant ceases to meet the requirements of the Rules under which the entry clearance was granted; or
    2.   b) the applicant does not present for travel to the UK, without reasonable excuse, when directed by the Home Office; or
    3.   c) the applicant does not collect their visa, without reasonable excuse, when directed by the Home Office; or
    4.   d) the applicant has been granted international protection elsewhere; or
    5.   e) it is discovered that the applicant had immigration permission in France at the time they applied or were being considered under the Scheme.
chunks.summary: The provision applies to applicants under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme, allowing permission cancellation if they fail to meet the initial requirements, do not travel or collect visas without valid reasons, acquire international protection elsewhere, or had prior French immigration permission. These conditions can lead to the revocation of their scheme permission.

Topic: leave-to-enter

Summary: The provision applies to applicants under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme, allowing permission cancellation if they fail to meet the initial requirements, do not travel or collect visas without valid reasons, acquire international protection elsewhere, or had prior French immigration permission. These conditions can lead to the revocation of their scheme permission.

### Cancellation of permission under UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

1.   UEATS 6.1. Permission under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme may be cancelled if: 
    1.   a) the applicant ceases to meet the requirements of the Rules under which the entry clearance was granted; or
    2.   b) the applicant does not present for travel to the UK, without reasonable excuse, when directed by the Home Office; or
    3.   c) the applicant does not collect their visa, without reasonable excuse, when directed by the Home Office; or
    4.   d) the applicant has been granted international protection elsewhere; or
    5.   e) it is discovered that the applicant had immigration permission in France at the time they applied or were being considered under the Scheme.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.section_id: Period and conditions under UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.section_title: Period and conditions under UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

chunks.text:
### Period and conditions under UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

UEATS 7.1. The applicant will be granted entry clearance to come to the UK for a period of up to three months.

1.   UEATS 7.2. The grant of entry clearance will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   a) No access to public funds; and
    2.   b) No work is permitted; and
    3.   c) No study is permitted.
chunks.summary: The UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme applies to applicants seeking entry clearance, granting up to three months. Conditions include no access to public funds, no work, and no study during this period.

### Period and conditions under UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

UEATS 7.1. The applicant will be granted entry clearance to come to the UK for a period of up to three months.

1.   UEATS 7.2. The grant of entry clearance will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   a) No access to public funds; and
    2.   b) No work is permitted; and
    3.   c) No study is permitted.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme

chunks.text:
### Travel document

UEATS 8.1. A person granted permission under UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme will be provided with a travel document to use to travel to the UK.

Print this page
chunks.summary: Individuals granted permission under the UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme will receive a travel document for UK travel. The document facilitates entry but does not specify conditions or exceptions beyond its provision.

### Travel document

UEATS 8.1. A person granted permission under UK/European Applicant Transfer Scheme will be provided with a travel document to use to travel to the UK.
